Notes: Throughout the series of books I have read one topic that remains constant is the discrimination against LGBTQ+ people
We will explore in-depth sexuality discrimination, trans discrimination and the negative effects of gender roles
All topics are present in “Keeping you a secret”, “Felix ever after” and “How To Kill a Mockingbird”.
In the book 'Keeping you a secret' we can see Holland and Cece get hated on for there sexuality
Several times we can see the abuse they receive from the other people in the book

examples of this can be seen such as when three male guys had Cece cornered against a vending machine saying crap such as 'Come on, one kiss. Try it, you’ll like it' this is shorty followed by one of the guys slamming Cece against the vending machine
Then he says 'Feel this? Huh?'.
Problem is that this crap still happens to this day, the abuse, the assault and it probably wont ever stop happening
there will always be people who consider the LGBTQ as 'less than', 'not human' or somebody who thinks they need to die
while reading the book 'Felix ever after' it is made clear that people will go far length to stupid crap

Austin is seen creating a instagram account with the name 'grandequeen69' messaging the protagonist transphobic messages such as 'I’m not trolling you. Im just telling you the truth. You were born a girl. You’ll always be a girl'
things like this are seen throughout the book.
transphobia is seen taking meany forms trout the book
In the book 'How to Kill a Mockingbird' one of the characters is named 'Scout Finch'
Scout shows tomboyish behavior such as not want to ware a dress, wanting to follow what all the boys wore doing
There are all these gender roles applyed to us at a young that we must follow or we are an 'out cast' or 'difrent' and so what?
i say to hell with gender roles, they have no good effects but they do have negitive effects.
in 2016 a studdy showed that 'only 10% of primary school teachers are men' and '38% of dads lie to their boss to take time off to spend time with their children
in the story we see that Scout gets discriminated against for not following the rules set in place for being a female
in my essay i follow the theam of LGBTQ discrimination and while a tomboy is not part of the LGBTQ comunity the same consept is there
